alert.note: Alert for Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 4:11PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Sussex, northwestern Warren, northeastern Monroe and northeastern Northampton Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 410 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Canadensis, or 9 miles east of Mount Pocono, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... East Stroudsburg, Blairstown, Flatbrookville, Henryville, Werry Lake, Analomink, Millbrook, Delaware Water Gap, Skytop, Mountainhome, Canadensis, Alpine Mountain, Five Points, Columbia, Crandon Lakes, Echo Lake, Paradise Valley, Stroudsburg, Portland and Cresco. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 311 and 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northwestern New Jersey...and eastern and northeastern Pennsylvania.
